children.text:
Thus, the code can be written like that. Putting this together, the entire Fortran program would look like:

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=1000) :: word, result
    integer :: uppercase = 0, lowercase = 0, i, n
    integer :: len_word

    read(*, '(A)') word
    len_word = len_trim(word)
    
    ! Count uppercase and lowercase
    do i = 1, len_word
        character :: c = word(i:i)
        integer :: cv = ichar(c) if (cv >= ichar('A') .and. cv <= ichar('Z')) then
            uppercase = uppercase +1
        else
            lowercase = lowercase +1
        endif
    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then
        ! Convert to uppercase do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = word(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('a') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('z')) then
                result(i:i) = char(ichar(c) - 32)
            else
                result(i:i) = c
            end if
        end do
    else
        ! Convert to lowercase do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = word(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
                result(i:i) = char(ichar(c) +32)
            else
                result(i:i) = c
            end if
        end do
    endif

    !

children.text:
Then, make a copy (temp) as the original, and modify temp. Wait, for example:

character(len=1000) :: word, temp

read(*,*) word

temp = word

Then do the uppercase/lowercase modification on temp. Thus, the code can become:

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=1000) :: word, temp
    integer :: uppercase, lowercase, i, len_word

    read(*, '(A)') word
    len_word = len_trim(word)
    temp = word  ! copies the string for modification

    uppercase = 0
    lowercase = 0
    do i = 1, len_word
        character :: c = word(i:i)
        if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
            uppercase = uppercase +1
        else
            lowercase = lowercase +1
        end if
    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = temp(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('a') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('z')) then
                temp(i:i) = char(ichar(c) - 32)
            end if
        end do
    else
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = temp(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
                temp(i:i) = char(ichar(c) + 32)
            end if
        end do
    end if

    write(*, '(A)') temp(1:len_word)
end program main

Hmm, this seems better, as it avoids the need to initialize a new result array. It modifies temp in place.

Putting this together, the entire Fortran program would look like:

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=1000) :: word, result
    integer :: uppercase = 0, lowercase = 0, i, n
    integer :: len_word

    read(*, '(A)') word
    len_word = len_trim(word)
    
    ! Count uppercase and lowercase
    do i = 1, len_word
        character :: c = word(i:i)
        integer :: cv = ichar(c)
        if (cv >= ichar('A') .and. cv <= ichar('Z')) then
            uppercase = uppercase +1
        else
            lowercase = lowercase +1
        endif
    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then
        ! Convert to uppercase
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = word(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('a') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('z')) then
                result(i:i) = char(ichar(c) - 32)
            else
                result(i:i) = c
            end if
        end do
    else
        ! Convert to lowercase
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = word(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
                result(i:i) = char(ichar(c) +32)
            else
                result(i:i) = c
            end if
        end do
    endif

    ! Trim the result to the length of the word (since result is initialized with trailing spaces)
    write(*, '(A)') trim(result)
end program main

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=1000) :: word, temp
    integer :: uppercase, lowercase, i, len_word

    read(*, '(A)') word
    len_word = len_trim(word)
    temp = word  ! copies the string for modification

    uppercase = 0
    lowercase = 0
    do i = 1, len_word
        character :: c = word(i:i)
        if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
            uppercase = uppercase +1
        else
            lowercase = lowercase +1
        end if
    end do

    if (uppercase > lowercase) then
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = temp(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('a') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('z')) then
                temp(i:i) = char(ichar(c) - 32)
            end if
        end do
    else
        do i = 1, len_word
            character :: c = temp(i:i)
            if (ichar(c) >= ichar('A') .and. ichar(c) <= ichar('Z')) then
                temp(i:i) = char(ichar(c) + 32)
            end if
        end do
    end if

    write(*, '(A)') temp(1:len_word)
end program main
